thread.title: Marion County braces for potential flooding from approaching storm
thread.title_full: Marion County braces for potential flooding from approaching storm

author: Michelle Meredith
title: Marion County braces for potential flooding from approaching storm
text: Marion County could bear the brunt of an incoming storm, with officials preparing for a potential flooding event."As of today, we are looking at this as more of a flooding event," the county's emergency manager, Preston Bowlin, told WESH 2. "We started our calls with the National Weather Service and the Florida Department of Emergency Management."Related: Invest 97-L tagged by NHC has high chance of development in latest updateThe Emergency Operations Center in Marion County is currently on standby â€“ personnel and equipment are ready to respond as needed. More: How to make a hurricane kit specific to you"We come together and we look these areas that have been prone to flooding in the past so we're preparing to make sure we have plenty of pumps (and) hoses," Bowlin said. "We call our municipalities our critical infrastructure (and) our hospitals nursing homes to make sure that we are able to try to stay ahead of it." Marion County is also arranging for sandbags to help manage potential flooding. Related: WESH 2 Hurricane Survival Guide 2024Related: Hurricane KidCast: What's a hurricane? And more answers to kids' questions
